Sheep and Wolves

How to mathematically model the populations of sheep and wolves?

Here, I will tell you about one of the first mathematical models in population ecology, it is the Lotka Volterra system. To launch the simulation, click on ‚Äúsetup‚Äù, then on ‚Äúgo‚Äù.

Two populations can be distinguished, wolves and sheep. Sheep eat grass and breed regularly. They can be eaten by wolves. Wolves need to eat sheep to be able to reproduce themselves, and if they don‚Äôt eat enough, they end up dying.
